title: What Would You do???
content:
[img]http://i11.tinypic.com/4mlwyma.jpg[/img]


What would you do if this was in your dream! Well it was in mine, Very strange. Right when I woke up I tryed my best to redraw it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img]


Is it a sign?

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
I don't think that's a sign... maybe a sign that you're crazy, but nothing else.-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
Were you stoned when you went to sleep, or when you drew that?

Is it a SIGN? As in you are asking us if it means anything? Um probably not. I guess you have been playing a lot of Commander Keen and or fixing oldschool computers.

Must agree with Q90 though... people have crazyass dreams. Don't take the weird ones too seriously.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
Haha, cool! The weird distortedness and missing details capture the dreamlike essence nicely.

I'd like to have another Keen dream... they're always great. The last one I actually remember was... I don't know when. Long before I found the PCKF, I'm pretty certain. There was a lot of underground stuff, and on the surface there were igloos. When I later played RKP3, it reminded me a lot of that dream.

[img]http://files.commanderkeen.org/users/jimage/images/keenigloodream.PNG[/img]

[hr]Q90 maybe a sign that you're crazy
[hr]Also, of course he's crazy. He hangs out at this forum.

[hr]Gal people have crazyass dreams. Don't take the weird ones too seriously.
[hr]Though they are useful as inspiration for new ideas.

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
Maybe your diet does not contain enough folic acid.

On the other hand, maybe your diet contains too much lysergic acid.

All kidding aside, that is a GREAT picture. I don't know what I like about it, but, hot diggity damn, it sure is awesome. Rest assured it will be haunting MY dreams.

What is it about retro games that make such a huge impression on our respective subconsciousnesses? Is it the primary colours? The supreme organizedness purveyed by the 16x16 tile? Or simply the surrealism in the games themselves?

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
It's probably just got to do with the fact you play them at such a young age. For example, I just watched a show I used to watch when I was, like, 3 (Dinosaurs, a live-action sitcom featuring dinosaurs), and I'm shocked by how much I remember. I'm also shocked by how dirty it was.

[quote]Quote:[hr]On the other hand, maybe your diet contains too much lysergic acid.[hr][/quote]
I think this is the first time I've ever needed to use "lol." But I'll just use this [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] instead and hide my emotions for now.

Keep off that Monterey Purple, kids!-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
Heh, nice. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

That'd nice looking fan game, Spleen. Especially like the stairs.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
I would...ehh...redraw it and post on this forum :X

When I was small I dreamt about CK, but I don't remember what happened. ._.

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
Some years ago, I dreamed of finding a secret level hid in a normal, common and pitiful patch of grass in Tuberia's world map. I entered it, and saw two of those CrazY Carrots running and hopping across a small level, , which had a giant SGA sign in the middle.

content: Ah, yes. Dinosaurs was (is) great. I acquired the first season last year, and it's still just as classy as ever.

content:

title: Re: What Would You do???
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] More interesting than Keen!? *tries to imagine, causing brainmelt*</exaggeration>

Seriously, though, the Keen atmosphere is one of the most interesting things I could possibly contemplate. A dream set in such an environment is truly an extraordinary experience, at least as much as those ones in which I can hover and swim around in the air.

title: das
content: The crazy thing was the Giant Pepsi can was chasing me jumping all around... I havent played the original Keen series seriously since 2002 or so. This came totally out of nowhere and Id figure I have to show you guys. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: das
content: Wow, I think I might make that first picture my desktop background.

Kudos for remembering Dinosaurs, Spleen. You have won my respect.-----------------------------------
